item.title: Australia news live: Qantas replaces tickets for 300 passengers who booked $4,300 first-class return tickets to US in ‘coding error’
item.description:
Airline says it accidentally sold fares for 85% less than the usual price. Follow today’s news headlines live

Investigations under way after alleged theft of non-fuctional guns from museum

An investigation is under way after a museum in Lithgow, in the NSW Central Tablelands, was allegedly broken into overnight.

Continue reading...

item.title: New Australian aviation regulators will oversee airline ticket refunds and noise complaints
item.description:
White paper’s 56 initiatives includes passenger rights charter which could see cash compensation for cancelled or delayed flights

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

The flying public in Australia will gain improved rights to seek refunds and remedies from airlines and people living under flight paths will be able to complain to a new aircraft noise ombudsman.

On Monday the Albanese government released its aviation white paper, and committed to 56 initiatives to improve fairness and accessibility at a time of dwindling competition.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email

Continue reading...

item.title: Orlando International Airport to build $1B facility, free up thousands of parking spaces
